body.p: To His excellency Thos E. Bramlet Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner would respectfuly represent unto your excellency that at the October term 1863, of the Lawrence Circuit Court a Judment was rendered against your petitioner for sixty dollars upon the charge of Keeping a Tipling house he made no defence to the Indictment knowing that he was guilty. but in excuse of the offence would state that he has a family that are dependent entirely upon his labour for a support, The war had prostrated business of every sort in Sandy Valley it was impossible to get work and to prevent starvation from visiting my wife and children I resorted to the sale of whiskey, for this I was Indicted and fined it was my first offense and shall be the last, If the collection of the Judgment is enforced I will have to go to Jail, and the little that I have will be from my wife and children. The consideration of the premises I earnestly invoke the executive Clemency and as in duty will every &c,
We the undersigned are acquainted with the petitioner and know that his case is deserving of executive interfrarence
